q1_issues_resolved.comment: 'All Themes Filtered' panel now includes complete actionable guidance. Users understand what happened (clear title + count), why it happened (explanation about low confidence/unknown vocabulary), and what to do next (3 specific suggestions: run with more conversations, check vocabulary coverage, review warnings). Styling is polished with amber background, proper icon, and well-organized action section. No UX regressions detected in the UI state machine.

summary: Round 2 verification PASSED. The Q1 issue raised in Round 1 has been properly addressed. The 'All Themes Filtered' panel at lines 1172-1203 now provides complete user guidance through: (1) Clear status communication (title + count), (2) Explanation of why filtering occurred, (3) Three actionable next steps. CSS styling (lines 1982-2044) is consistent with the design system and uses appropriate amber color scheme for quality warnings. No UX regressions detected in the conditional rendering logic or other pipeline page features. All six major UI states render correctly. Accessibility is solid with semantic HTML, good contrast, and icon-based visual indicators. Content tone is helpful and action-oriented. Ready to APPROVE.

elements_added: Filter icon SVG (visual indicator of quality gates)
Count display showing number of filtered themes
Actionable guidance section with 'What to do' header
Three bullet-point suggestions for user action
q1_fix_details.css_classes: filtered-themes-panel, filtered-title, filtered-count, filtered-explanation, filtered-actions, filtered-suggestion, filtered-suggestions-list
q1_fix_details.content_assessment: Comprehensive - addresses all three user questions: 'What happened?', 'Why did it happen?', 'What should I do?'

styling_verification.visual_hierarchy: Proper - title (16px bold) > count (13px) > explanation (12px tertiary) > actions (12px secondary) > list items (12px tertiary)
styling_verification.padding_spacing: 32px container padding with 16px internal spacing - good breathing room
styling_verification.consistency: Matches existing design system with CSS variables (--accent-amber, --text-* variables)

verified_features: Themes ready for creation (lines 1083-1143) - renders correctly
Themes extracted not ready (lines 1145-1168) - renders correctly
no_regression_analysis.conditional_logic_correctness: All state transitions verified. Six distinct UI states render in correct priority order with proper fallthrough logic.
